str2: (a) there, yonder, in that place, (b) thither, there. Of uncertain affinity; there; by extension, thither.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Weeping, lamentation, crying. From klaio; lamentation.
And, even, also, namely.
A grinding or gnashing. From brucho; a grating.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A tooth. Perhaps from the base of esthio; a 'tooth'.
When, whenever. From hote and an; whenever; also causatively inasmuch as.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Middle - 2nd Person Plural
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
Abraham, progenitor of the Hebrew race. Of Hebrew origin; Abraham, the Hebrew patriarch.
(Hebrew), Isaac, the patriarch. Of Hebrew origin; Isaac, the son of Abraham.
Of Hebrew origin; Jacob, the progenitor of the Israelites.
And, even, also, namely.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a compound of pro and phemi; a foreteller; by analogy, an inspired speaker; by extension, a poet.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From basileus; properly, royalty, i.e. rule, or a realm.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: To throw (cast, put) out; I banish; I bring forth, produce. From ek and ballo; to eject.
Without, outside. Adverb from ek; out(-side, of doors), literally or figuratively.
